title: Jan Vertonghen suffers instant black-eye after clash of heads in Brighton fixture
text:
Jan Vertonghen has suffered his second black eye of the week in Tottenham's woeful defeat against Brighton.

The Tottenham centre back clashed with Brighton's Neal Maupay and received immediate treatment on the field.

The injury came after Tottenham had already lost Hugo Lloris, who suffered a horrible elbow injury following an awkward fall.

Jan Vertonghen suffered the black eye after clashing heads with Neal Maupay

Vertonghen required attention on the field after the sickening clash of heads

The clash of heads saw Vertonghen sustain a shiner to his left eye midway through first half

The injury was the second black eye the Belgian has received this week

The Spurs skipper was given oxygen in the incident which saw Brighton take the lead in the game at the Amex.

Vertonghen then suffered a less serious blow but still required attention before he was able to continue as Spurs were put under the pump in the opening stages of their Premier League fixture against Brighton.

Vertonghen had been given a black eye in an accidental training incident earlier in the week which, according to The Sun, involved Christian Eriksen.

His first came in an accidental incident which was said to have involved Christian Eriksen

His latest blow symbolised the battering Tottenham took away against Brighton

However, claims emerged soon after that the Belgian defender had been involved in a massive bust-up with team-mate Harry Kane after rumours suggested he had slept with Eriksen's girlfriend Sabrina Kvist.

Eriksen then took to Twitter to furiously deny the allegations, labelling them bulls***, before Vertonghen then replied to Eriksen's tweet with a serious of emojis that showed he agreed.

The injuries to Vertonghen and now Lloris have come in a torrid week for Tottenham, who were humiliated 7-2 in the Champions League by Bayern Munich in midweek, which exacerbated the ill-feeling around the club this season.
description: The Spurs defender suffered the black eye after clashing heads with Brighton's Neal Maupays and received attention on the field after the incident.
